Allergy & Immunology.Content: Many patients don't respond to the standard therapies of proton pump inhibitors, steroids, or diet. Some evidence suggests that EoE might be driven by type 2 inflammation, and dupilumab's effect on the shared receptor of IL-4 and IL-13 directly counters that pathway

Business of Medicine.Title: Medicaid Issues, Not Medicare's, Get Fixes in Biden Budget
Business of Medicine.Content: The budget blueprint Biden released Thursday would fulfill a campaign promise to help poor people locked out of Medicaid expansion across the South due to partisan battles, and it would provide low-income seniors and disabled people with more options to stay out of nursing homes by getting support in their own homes. It also calls for 12 months of Medicaid coverage after childbirth for low-income mothers, seen as a major step to address national shortcomings in maternal health that fall disproportionately on Black women

Medical Students.Title: Russian Says He Dressed as Doctor to Tend to Grandmother in COVID Ward
Medical Students.Content: Sergei, who declined to give his surname, told Rain TV in an interview broadcast on Thursday that he donned protective clothing and walked into the hospital ward in the city of Tomsk last week where he looked after his grandmother for three days, giving her food and pills and changing her bandages and incontinence pads.

Nurses.Title: Safety Nets Kept US Uninsured Rate Steady During Pandemic, HHS Says
Nurses.Content: Safety nets like Medicaid and re-opening enrollment through the Affordable Care Act helped stabilize uninsured rates even while millions lost employer-related health insurance coverage as the pandemic rattled the U. S

Nurses.Content: This story was co-published with NPR.

Nurses.Title: Sweden Acted Too Slowly as Pandemic Swept Country, Commission Finds
Nurses.Content: Sweden's strategy, shunning lockdowns and measures such as widespread use of face masks and only gradually tightening curbs, made the country an outlier in the first year of the pandemic when many countries across Europe chose to implement far tougher restrictions.

Pharmacists.Title: Fewer Deaths in Hospitalized COVID Patients on an ACEi or ARB
Free Vitamin D No Better at Predicting Death in Men Than Standard Testing
Pharmacists.Content: "In this prospective, population-based study of middle-aged and older European men, total 25(OH)D levels below 20 µg/L were independently associated with a twofold increased all-cause mortality," the researchers reported.

Pharmacists.Title: DMTs Often Switched During COVID, but Was It Necessary?
Clinicians May Overprescribe Clarithromycin for H pylori
Pharmacists.Content: In an analysis of 1 million US prescriptions for H pylori infections, 80% contained clarithromycin, said Carol Rockett, PharmD, associate vice president of RedHill Biopharma in Raleigh, North Carolina.

Flouting White House, Florida Penalizes School Districts
Residents.Content: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) — The state of Florida has withheld funding from two school districts over their coronavirus mask mandates, flouting threats from White House officials who warned that such penalties would violate federal law

Today on Medscape.Title: COVID-19 Memorial Creators Reflect as World Nears 5M Deaths
Today on Medscape.Content: With the Washington Monument in the background, people look at white flags that are part of artist Suzanne Brennan Firstenberg's temporary art installation, "In America: Remember. "

Today on Medscape.Title: COVID Vaccines Provide 5 Times the Protection of Natural Immunity
Today on Medscape.Content: Unvaccinated people who had a recent infection were five times more likely to be reinfected with the coronavirus compared to those who were fully vaccinated and didn't have a prior infection, according to a new study published Friday in the CDC's Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report.

Today on Medscape.Title: White House Press Secretary Tests Positive for COVID-19
Today on Medscape.Content: White House press secretary Jen Psaki announced Sunday that she has tested positive for a breakthrough case of COVID-19 but had not been near President Joe Biden since at least Tuesday.

Today on Medscape.Title: Nondiabetes Hospitalization Is Wrong Time to Up Diabetes Meds
Today on Medscape.Content: They found that, in a national cohort of older almost entirely male veterans with non–insulin-treated type 2 diabetes who were hospitalized for non–diabetes-related common medical conditions, intensified diabetes treatment on hospital discharge was linked to an increased risk of severe hypoglycemia in the immediate postdischarge period.
